instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
Hi.

This one was liquid damaged, a small amount of rain water. Trackpad and IPD flex was a little corroded, did not turn on. Changed them and it started. Checked all logic board for corrosion under microscope, nothing to see.

Now it is working but is loosing half of its charge over night in sleep mode. Battery goes from 100% to around 50%. I think it is too much drain. I have checked with two known-good batteries already.

Any hints?

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Corrosion in the connector or trackpad? Does the machine really sleep or just LCD goes off?

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
Thanks. Yes there was corrosion but as I wrote i changed both cable and trackpad.

I'm pretty sure it goes to sleep. Fan stops but haven't measured any rails while sleeping

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Is it also loosing charge when totally shut down?

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: I did not try that. I will try. Thanks

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Yes. Also draining a little when turned off. Lost 10% in 5 hours.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Check if L3895 has voltage on it when system is off.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
There is no L3895 on this one?

Do you mean L3095. If so there is no voltage on it.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
Yes L3095, sorry.
If it is draining when it is off there must be a leak from S5 busses to somewhere. Check 3v3_s4 and 5v_s4 if they have no power. If ok then onto all S3 rails.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
Ok. It seems I must have remembered wrong when making the first test on losing charge while shut off... Because it is NOT as first stated.

After double checking it appears that it is only losing power while sleeping.

I checked all S4 and S3 while turned off anyways and no power on any of these.

So sorry. But we must start this one over. I hope you've got some hints.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Remove everything that is not needed, airport, camera, etc. Swap the IO board and cable.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
New DC-in board, new IO cable, airport disconnected - still draining in sleep mode...

Now what ?

Thanks

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Was there corrosion on trackpad connector on the board side?

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: It was on trackpad. Board connector was perfectly clean and shiny on all pins

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Sykulski, post: 9302"]New DC-in board, new IO cable, airport disconnected - still draining in sleep mode...

Now what ?

Thanks[/QUOTE]

Was camera disconnected?

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: I did not but just tested without it for 5 hours. Battery charge went down from 100% to 74% with camera disconnected in the last 5 hours while sleeping.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Is this really going to sleep? Are S0 voltages going off?

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
Hmmm. Actually not. It's apparently playing possum with me. I got power on S0 even when I use the Apple-menu to go sleep... WTF! I was thinking it was sleeping because the fan stopped. Motherf*****!! Please spank me next time I just assume instead of just measuring the fucking shit. Sorry man!

What can be the cause for this? Thanks Duke...

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: R8178 going low in sleep? CPU Vcore going off?

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
Nope.

R8178 = 3.3V
PPVCC_S0_CPU = 0.8V

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: So the fan and backlight do go off?

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Yes. Fan stops. Backlight goes off. Image on screen disappears. Also light in USB mouse goes off.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: I have no idea, it is corrosion somewhere. Inspect for corrosion and UC it.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Ok. Will do. Thanks again

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message:
Inspected very closely for corrosion. Did not find anything. Looks perfect. UC'ed it. Put the MLB in another fully working machine. 

Battery still draining in "sleep-mode"

I lost against this one :-(

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: Was it messed with, it may be an ME issue. Compare serial number in OSX with the one on the bottom cover.

threads.title: 820-3437 - Loosing half charge over night in sleep mode
threads.message: No it was not messed with. I was the first one opening this for sure. Serial # is correct. Customer told me he left it by an open window and it rained onto it for a little while. After this he could not turn it on and brought it to me.
